name: unappeased
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a person or their feelings are unappeased, they still have the same feelings: This is just the latest proof that the business community remains aggrieved and unappeased. Eventually, the crowd dispersed with unappeased curiosity and suspicion.
More examplesFewer examplesStruggling investors want the government to lower taxes; so far, they are unappeased.In spite of Molly's smiles, the woman stood there, angry and unappeased.Over 100 people have been killed in the riots, and the anger and pain remain unappeased.
